licence_overview:
If you make cider or perry for sale and your total production - including any for your own consumption - in any 12 months period either exceeds 7,000 litres (70 hectolitres), or is likely to do so, then you need to register the premises on which it is produced with HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC).

##Conditions
You must also register if you render cider or perry sparkling, unless you intend to carry out this process in an excise warehouse - a place approved by HMRC for the holding of goods on which excise duty is suspended. You may produce cider or perry and sparkling cider or perry on the same registered premises.

##How to apply
You should apply for registration on form CP 30.

$D
[Download Form CP30, Application by maker of cider or perry for registration (PDF, 8KB)](http://customs.hmrc.gov.uk/channelsPortalWebApp/downloadFile?contentID=HMCE_CL_000326 "Download Form CP30, Application by maker of cider or perry for registration (PDF, 8KB)") 
$D

A separate registration is needed for each set of premises where you intend to make cider or perry for sale.

As part of your application, you must make entry of the premises and plant you intend to use. This involves creating a plan describing and showing the position of each room, place and vessel that you use in the production process.

The plan should be submitted with your application to the HMRC National Registration Unit (the address is listed on the form).

No fee is payable and the registration will last until you stop trading.

You must keep the certificate of registration on your premises and produce it on request for inspection by HMRC officers.

You may claim exemption from registration if your total production in any rolling period of 12 consecutive months does not exceed 70,000 litres (70 hectolitres). To claim exemption you must download form CP 33 and return it to the HMRC National Registration Unit.

$D
[Download Form CP33, Application by maker of cider or perry for registration (PDF, 8KB)](http://customs.hmrc.gov.uk/channelsPortalWebApp/downloadFile?contentID=HMCE_CL_000296
 "Download Form CP30, Application by maker of cider or perry for exemption from registration (PDF, 8KB)") 
$D

If you have any queries about registering, call the HMRC Excise Helpline.

$C
**HMRC Excise Helpline**  

0845 010 9000  
**Textphone:** 0845 601 5613  
Monday to Friday, 8am to 8pm
$C

If you are operating in an excise warehouse, you don't need to register, but you will need authorisation from HMRC to deal in duty-suspended goods.

##Fines and penalties
If you produce cider or perry on unregistered premises, you may be fined. The cider or perry and all vessels, utensils and materials used in the production process may also be forfeited.



*[HMRC]: HM Revenue & Customs

overview: To make cider or perry in the UK you need to register with HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC)
